Text: DraftSummaryOriginal Message From Semin Frank Sent Thursday November AM To Barker Courtney Subject RE Clayton Energy could you also send a copy to Lynn Blair and myself thanks fs Original Message From Barker Courtney Sent Thursday November AM To Semin Frank Subject RE Clayton Energy Frank I sent the draft of the summary to Dave yesterday Ill let you know if I receive any comments Original Message From Semin Frank Sent Thursday November AM To Neubauer Dave Cc Barker Courtney Subject FW Clayton Energy Dave here is another example of the underlying issues concerning the practice of index readings because of late charts Courtney will distribute a summary draft of our recommendations later today specifically addressing the and day charts issues Original Message From Floyd Jodie Sent Wednesday November PM To Anderson Gary E Adams Frankie Cc Lagerstrom Karen Semin Frank Blair Lynn Zadow Raetta Subject Clayton Energy Gary I received a call on from Bill Lindley Clayton Energy agent for City of Hartley IA Bill was inquiring about the actual daily volume allocations at POI Meter Number He incurred about in DDVC penalties for the month of Oct due to daily variances at the TBS Bill was asking if the actuals were estimated from the th st In checking with Frankie the end of the month index readings were used to estimate the volume due to the chart being received after close Bill Clayton Energy has requested that we pull the charts and check the reading to verify that the penalties and the daily volume are correct for the month of Oct Bill has provided me with the daily readings from his check meter at this TBS to compare with This check will determine if the daily volumes need to be reallocated and a PPA generated Give me a call if you have any questions j floyd

Cc On behalf of Dave NeubauerFrank Semin Lynn Blair and Jodie Floyd In followup to our conference call Thursday morning we would like to communicate the Todos we are recommending It is very important that we get the charts to Houston by the rd business day of the month We need to encourage chart changers to get their charts in the mail immediately As the charts are received in Houston it is recommended that Gas Measurement Services will be in charge of not only inputting the chart data but also tracking and keeping a report on when each chart is received Once we determine which charts are consistently late we will determine what action needs to be taken to get the charts in on time whether it be Priority Mail Service or Overnight Service Prior Period Adjustments will be done on each chart that is received late As we continue to work through this problem ongoing research and planning will be done to ensure that a capital commitment is made to get technology installed to eliminate this ongoing issue It is important that the Operations personnel communicate to the chart changers the importance of getting the charts in the mail box immediately Effective immediately it is recommended that Gas Measurement Services track the receipt of the charts and provide a report to Gas Logistics Jodie Floyd and Marketing that details which charts arent coming in on time We need to have the report shortly after GMS closes so that we can make efforts to locate the missing charts and get them to Houston as soon as possible Once we identify the charts that we are coming in late we will provide either Priority Mail envelopes or Overnight envelopes to those stations so we can ensure that the chart will be on time the following month PPAs will continue on all charts that are received late Measurement will review possible technology to improve the accuracy of our measurements ie temperaturebased calculation chart delineator If you have any questions please contact Courtney Barker Marketing at or Jodie Floyd Gas Logistics at Please forward this on to any necessary personnel

Duke Field Services Contract Cc In our effort to decide if we need to renegotiate contract and with Duke to possibly eliminate the BTU Daily Gas Wire numbers and instead use the Gas Daily numbers I have attached a spreadsheet that gives the Gas Daily and BTU Daily Gas Wire numbers for Mid and Demarc Randy could you please run the Gas Daily numbers in your calculation for the last months We would like to see the bottom line impact between using the BTU Daily Gas Wire publication vs the Gas Daily publication We are hoping this will give some insight on whether it would be beneficial to us to renegotiate the contracts Thanks Courtney Barker
